document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content: Always wash your hands with antibacterial soap before eating to reduce the risk of Helicobacter Pylori infection; Eat cooked food and drink boiled food to avoid the risk of infection.; Avoid or limit drinking alcohol as much as possible; Regularly wash your hands with soap and water before meals. This may reduce your risk of getting infected with H. pylori.; Cook food thoroughly. This also reduces the risk of infection.; Avoid drinking alcohol or limit alcohol intake.; Avoid using non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) regularly.
